page.title: 01South West of Lhanbryde
page.content: The area lies south of busy A96 Inverness to Aberdeen Rd. The B9103 to Cranloch passes through a fertile area of mixed farmland with some forestry and commercial woodland. It is dominate by the Blackbills Estate belonging to the Christie family since 1900. While there were once 24 farms there are now five averaging about 250acres but a trend away from the depopulation of the 40s and 50s is beginning to show with families slowly moving back. Some farms are primarily pastoral Clackmaison for example situatedd in the only small community here of some 16 houses has a 300acre dairy farm with 200 head of cattle. An interesting development is scotsburn fruit farm where Baxters of speyside grow raspberries, strawberries and vegetables for their factory. They operate a pick yor own fruit facility.
